meanings.definition: A small bird known for catching insects, especially gnats.
meanings.sent1: The gnatcatchers chirped happily as they darted around catching gnats for their meal.
meanings.sent2: I saw a gnatcatchers perched on a branch, skillfully snatching gnats out of the air.
meanings.sent3: The gnatcatchers decided to host a gnat-catching competition to see who could catch the most in an hour.
meanings.sent4: Watching the gnatcatchers in action was like witnessing a skilled hunter stalking its prey.
meanings.sent5: The gnatcatchers' swift movements and sharp beaks make them the ultimate gnat hunters.

meanings.definition: People who catch or trap gnats for various purposes.
meanings.sent1: The gnatcatchers set up traps in the garden to catch the pesky insects bothering the plants.
meanings.sent2: As gnatcatchers, they were experts at catching gnats using specialized tools and techniques.
meanings.sent3: The gnatcatchers formed a club where they shared tips and tricks on gnat-catching strategies.
meanings.sent4: In the world of gnatcatchers, patience and precision are key to successful gnat trapping.
meanings.sent5: The gnatcatchers' dedication to their craft made them the go-to experts in gnat control.
